subject: Investing
title: Blue-Chip Stocks
description: A fast breakdown of Blue-Chip Stocks for builders.

hook.text: The name comes from poker. Blue chips are the most valuable. On Wall Street, they're the most trusted companies.

buildup.text: Blue-chips are large, established companies with decades of profits. Johnson & Johnson, Procter & Gamble, Visa.

discovery.text: They usually pay reliable dividends and grow steadily. Boring, but they form the backbone of most portfolios.

twist.text: Blue-chip status isn't permanent. GE was the ultimate blue-chip for a century. Then it fell apart.

climax.text: Of the original 12 Dow stocks from 1896, none remain in the index today. Even giants fade over time.

punchline.text: Blue-chips feel safe. But no company is immortal.

quiz.question: Where does the term 'blue-chip' originate?
options: Poker, where blue chips are most valuable
The color of early stock certificates
